CV

A detailed CV is available in PDF format.

Basics

Name Iana Atanassova
Title Full Professor in Natural Language Processing
Email iana.atanassova@univ-fcomte.fr
Url https://iana-atanassova.github.io/
Summary Director of the CRIT laboratory at the Universit Marie et Louis Pasteur, France.
Member of Institut Universitaire de France (IUF).

Work

  • 2025.09 - Present
    Full Professor in Natural Language Processing
    Université Marie et Louis Pasteur (formerly Université de Franche-Comté), France
    Full Professor and Director of Centre de Recherches Interdisciplinaires et Transculturelles (CRIT) in Besançon, France. Research in NLP specializing in scientific discourse analysis, uncertainty modeling, information extraction.
    • Head of CRIT laboratory
    • Research on scientific text processing
    • Supervision of doctoral and postdoctoral researchers
    • Course manager of the MSc degree in NLP
  • 2021.09 - Present
    Junior Member
    Institut Universitaire de France (IUF)
    Junior member involved in interdisciplinary research funded by IUF, with emphasis on Natural Language Processing and scientific knowledge modeling.
  • 2014.09 - 2015.08
    Assistant Professor in Natural Language Processing
    Université de Franche-Comté, France
    Teaching and research in NLP, including computational linguistics courses.
  • 2014.01 - 2014.08
    Post-doctoral fellow
    Concordia University, Montréal, Canada
    Semantic processing of corpora in humanities and social sciences.
  • 2012.03 - 2013.06
    Research and Development Manager
    MyScienceWork
    Implemented search engine for scientific papers for a social network specializing in scholarly communication.

Awards

  • 2021.09
    IUF (Institut Universitaire de France) Research Grant, Junior Member
    Institut Universitaire de France
    Support for interdisciplinary research in Natural Language Processing.
  • 2017.01
    First Prize of the InovHackTion Hackathon
    French Air Force
    Award for intelligent analysis of documents.

Projects

  • 2021.01 - 2025.12
    InSciM - Modelling Uncertainty in Science
    ANR JCJC funded research project addressing linguistic modeling of scientific uncertainty. French ANR grant number ANR-21-CE38-0003-01.
  • 2021.01 - 2023.06
    Automatic correction of text responses to exams
    Collaboration and technology transfer to the start-up e-Cole, funded by Technopole de la Réunion.
  • 2020.10 - 2024.09
    EMONTAL - Extraction and Ontology Modeling of Subjects and Places for the Exploitation of the Documentary Funds of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
    Project for documentary fund exploitation, funded by Région Bourgogne Franche-Comté.
  • 2020.01 - 2022.06
    DecRIPT - Detection of the Representations of Personal Data in Texts
    Project funded by Interreg France-Switzerland 2014-2020 and Communauté du Savoir, Switzerland.
    • Developing tools for GDPR compliance via text processing
    • Academic partners : HEG (Switzerland), HEG Arc (Switzerland)
    • Private partners : ERDIL (France), Global Data Excellence (Switzerland)

Education

  • 2015.12 - 2014.12

    Besançon, France

    Habilitation to Direct Research (HDR) in Natural Language Processing
    Université de Franche-Comté (now Université Marie et Louis Pasteur)
    Qualitative and quantitative analysis of scientific discourse. Applications to Information Extraction, Information Retrieval and the Semantic Web
  • 2012.01 - 2007.10

    Paris, France

    PhD in Mathematics, Informatics and Applications to Human Sciences
    Université Paris-Sorbonne
    Exploiting semantic annotations for information retrieval and text navigation
  • 2005.09 - 2007.06

    Paris, France

    MSc Information and Communication
    Université Paris-Sorbonne
  • 2004.09 - 2005.06

    Sofia, Bulgaria

    MSc in Computational Linguistics
    Sofia University
  • 2000.09 - 2004.06

    Sofia, Bulgaria

    BSc in Mathematics
    Sofia University
    • With a parallel course of BSc in English Philology (2002-2004).
